text.value: why when i'm in MangaFragment and i click on libriray nothing happen ?

There could be a few reasons why clicking on the library tab while in the MangaFragment does nothing:
1. The navigation logic is not set up correctly to handle navigating from MangaFragment back to LibraryFragment. The NavController needs to have navigation actions defined to go between these fragments.
2. The onClick handler for the library tab is not wired up properly to call the navigation action. Make sure the tab is calling navController.navigate(...) with the correct route to go back to LibraryFragment.
3. There may be an issue with the NavHost or NavController setup that is preventing the navigation from working properly. Double check that the NavHost has both MangaFragment and LibraryFragment defined as composable destinations.
4. The current destination may not be popping off the backstack properly when navigating. You could try explicitly popping the current destination first before navigating back to LibraryFragment.
Some things to try:
- Add logging to see if the library tab click is being handled - Simplify the navigation to have just 2 destinations - Explicitly pop the current destination before navigating back - Verify the NavHost and NavController setup - Check that the navigation actions and routes are defined correctly
Let me know if any of those suggestions help uncover the issue!

2024-03-08 18:06:53.650 716-1496 BufferQueueDebug surfaceflinger E [Splash Screen com.example.an_other_manga_app$_1657#0](this:0xb40000762f63b948,id:-1,api:0,p:-1,c:-1) id info cannot be read from 'Splash Screen com.example.an_other_manga_app$_1657#0'

This log message indicates that there was an issue reading the id information from the SurfaceFlinger buffer queue associated with the splash screen for your app com.example.an_other_manga_app.
A few things could cause this:
- The splash screen surface was already closed or invalid when SurfaceFlinger tried to read its id info. This could happen if the splash screen finished very quickly.
- There is a bug in SurfaceFlinger or the system UI code that draws the splash screen.
- Your app set up the splash screen incorrectly, for example not specifying a valid SurfaceControl when creating the splash screen.
This doesn't necessarily indicate a serious problem - it's just SurfaceFlinger complaining that it couldn't read debug info from the splash screen surface. The app should still function normally.
You could try enabling debug logs for SurfaceFlinger and your app to see if there are any other clues about what happened when the splash screen was shown. But in most cases this message can be ignored if you are not seeing any visible issues with the splash screen.
